attributes.action: Tv advertisment to raise awareness on using country roads #ThinkCountryside.
attributes.background: There are a increasing number of incidents involving horses and cyclists on our country roads. A Tv advertisement will help raise awareness in educating communities on the dangers of blind bends. Detailed examples on How to pass horses and cyclists safely on the country roads.
attributes.additional_details: An Educational TV advertisement is the way forward in educating all road users to help reduce accidents and fatalities.

attributes.action: Stop trading & supporting India until it stops human rights violation in Kashmir
attributes.background: Draconian laws such as AFSPA & PSA are used by India to commit human rights violations in Kashmir with impunity, over last 44 days of worst curfew imposed in Kashmir, Indian forces have killed over 70+ civilians, 200+ blinded using pellets, including young kids as young as 1 year, injured 8000+.
attributes.additional_details:
Insha, 14 year old is battling for her life due to serious brain injury after been hit by pellets aimed deliberately at upper body.

Essentials supplies like food, water & medicine have been curtailed, communication restricted, an ambulance driver shot while transporting patient to hospital, Lecturer dragged from home and beaten to death. 

We people of Britain have an obligation to put an end to these human rights violations.

attributes.action: Stop the M56 new junction 11a scheme.
attributes.background: Highways England are planning to introduce a M56 junction 11a. The plans squeeze a new junction between 2 existing junctions that are no more than 4 miles apart. No evidence has been offered by Highways England to justify it's need or cost. It would have a severe impact on several local communities.
attributes.additional_details: Having reviewed the existing plans many residents are sceptical about the motive for this junction. They believe that the new junction would only serve to channel traffic towards a new Mersey Toll Bridge crossing (currently under construction) and will do nothing to ease the serious congestion issues that already exist between Junction 12 and 14.

attributes.action: Do not bring in a fee/charge to use Recycling Centres nationwide
attributes.background: My local council and I am sure many will follow suit are planning to start charging for certain types of waste brought to the Recycling Centre. I would like the Government to stop this charge as I fear it will encourage fly tipping.

attributes.action: If House of Lords frustrates Article 50 then hold referendum on future of Lords
attributes.background: If the House of Lords frustrates the democratic will of the people to leave the EU by delaying or blocking the triggering of Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty the Government should call a national referendum on the dissolution of the House

attributes.action: Reduce the women's retirement age back to 60.
attributes.background: Women work hard within the workplace and having to work many extra hours at home.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for politicians to lie to the public.
attributes.background: We cannot call ourselves a functioning democracy if our democratic decisions are taken based on lies and deceptions. We therefore demand that any politician who lies to or misleads the public be held legally accountable, and a new agency be set up to monitor political advertising and promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that any politician who lies for personal or political gain should: 
1/ Be removed from their position
2/ Be banned from all public offices for a minimum of ten years
3/ Pay a fine based on the severity of the crime and their ability to pay
Any legislation enacted based on the lie must to be cancelled.
An independent body must be set up to monitor politicians to this effect, and also to monitor political advertising and campaign materials, similarly to the Advertising Standards Agency.

attributes.action: Award QTS as part of EYITT
attributes.background: EYITT's have to meet the same entry requirements and the same set of rigorous standards as their counterparts who achieve QTS.
attributes.additional_details:
Without QTS, EYT's have found that they do not receive equal stature, pay or recognition for the demanding work that they carry out and their dedication, passion and commitment towards the teaching profession and children and families aged 0-5.

http://www.nurseryworld.co.uk/nursery-world/news/1159248/early-years-pay-and-conditions-survey-2016

https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/eligibility-for-teacher-training

attributes.action: Call for No Confidence in PM Theresa May
attributes.background: Theresa May was appointed as PM of the UK when David Cameron stepped down. The public did not vote for her and she does not speak for the majority of the British Public.
attributes.additional_details:
After her short time in office May has already managed to enrage most of the British Public. 
We voted her party to speak on behalf of us in parliament but she doesn't seem interested by our worries or voices. It's time someone else spoke for us.

attributes.action: RAISE ISSUE OF PERSECUTION OF POLITICAL ACTIVISTS WITH MUGABE REGIME IN ZIMBABWE
attributes.background: We ask the UK govt to raise the issue of persecution of activists with the Zimbabwe govt. The last election was hugely rigged. Misgovernance & corruption have destroyed the economy resulting in starvation & 90% unemployment. Civil unrest is growing & protesters refused bail & jailed without trial.
attributes.additional_details: Linda Masarira, locked up since 6 July on trumped-up charges, has health problems & is the mother of 5 children (youngest 2 yrs). Accused of inciting riots in the female section of Chikurubi prison on 10/9, she was moved to solitary confinement in the dangerous male section – we fear for her safety. Other activists are also still incarcerated, many needing medical care after violent treatment by the police. Both Gift Siziba’s hands are believed to be broken.  This vicious persecution must stop.

attributes.action: Include ADHD in the Disability Living Allowance SMI Criteria.
attributes.background: Make ADHD automatically an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain for Disability Living Allowance (Severe Mental Impairement Rules). Autism Spectrum Disorder is now automatically accepted as an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain, and ADHD should be too.
attributes.additional_details: ADHD comes little danger awareness and it is extremely hard to bring up a child who does not understand anything about danger, this means they need more help when out and about. To pass the severe mental impairment part of DLA you need to have an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain. ADHD is exactly that however, it is not automatically classed as that. I feel like this condition is too overlooked and we are still stuck in the dark ages regarding our views on it.

attributes.action: Introduce meat and dairy taxes to correct market failure in the food industry
attributes.background: Food production causes a quarter of all greenhouse gas emissions that are driving global warming. Both the UN International Research Panel and the Oxford University Martin Programme have suggested pricing in the environmental impacts of meat and dairy are vital steps to combating climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oxford report states average surcharges of 40% on beef and 20% on milk would account for the damage they cause people via climate change and Maarten Hajer, the lead author of the UN report has recommended similar action. We hereby call on the government to implement such taxes to help meet our international obligations to combat climate change. 

http://www.nature.com/nclimate/journal/vaop/ncurrent/pdf/nclimate3155.pdf
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/bhhivquadq7ycnd/AAAIl8mVW9GCiOyGwk71At_ra?dl=0

attributes.action: The Government must declare the actual and true cost of Brexit.
attributes.background: The government should publicly publish a clear, factual and verified estimate for the total cost of Brexit from the 23 June 2015 until 31 March 2019 with all the GBP devaluation, legal, on costs, travel etc declared not hidden as there seems to be some misguided illusion as to these true real costs.

attributes.action: To create awareness and delvelop treatment on Temporomandibular Joint disorders
attributes.background:
The symptoms of TMJD include facial pain, reduced mouth opening and headaches which can be very debilitating. 

PURPOSE: 
- patients need to know which treatments they can access 
- to create more TMJD centers on the NHS in all regions of the UK, not just London
- more research into TMJD.
attributes.additional_details: TMJD affects approx. 25% of the population. There are very few NHS clinics which provide TMJD treatment in the UK compared to the USA even though there are NICE Guidelines set out for TMJD, most patients who do not know that treatment is available.

attributes.action: Form a British Expat Committee to defend Expats rights in pre-Brexit negotiation
attributes.background: This Committee is to consist of representatives from Spain, Ireland, Germany, France and Italy to cover the diverse social demographics of the 5 main countries.  It will contend issues raised during the Brexit debate prior to negotiations which adversely affect the rights and welfare of Expats.
attributes.additional_details: Of critical importance is that Government decisions concerning Expats be negotiated with Brussels after having consulted with the committee.  Currently the anxieties and opinions of ordinary Expats are not being sought on issues directly affecting them and their futures.  Government decision-makers will not be affected by outcomes which have an impact on Expats’ rights, healthcare and the benefits they enjoy.  The futures of Expats must not be regarded as bargaining chips.

attributes.action: Call for a referendum on the production, sale and use of cannabis becoming legal
attributes.background: The rest of the modernised world are liberalising their drug policies towards cannabis, 6.6% of Britons use it annually highlighting the direct mainstream support for the plant and the current % of population forced into the illicit market. Leave the decision to the people through a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: America, Holland & Spain all have established legal frameworks showing how this drug can be safely implemented into society. It is said that the UK cannabis market could bring in £900m through taxes, save £400m on policing the drug & create 10,000+ jobs. It's proven legalisation of the drug reduces harm to individuals & communities through introduction of a regulated market & proper treatment. Our outdated system has discredited the law & empowers criminals, forcing users into the illicit market

attributes.action: Introduce online voting in elections allowing more people to engage in democracy
attributes.background: Vote online using NI numbers to identify people. A unique code could be sent at registration that would then be entered along with their NI Number to secure the process. Email confirmation could be sent after voting as a security measure. This allows people to vote if out of their constituency.
attributes.additional_details:
Only 36% of 18-24 year olds voted in the last referendum, and only 66% of the electorate voted in the general election in 2015.

Younger voters are often moving around the country and unable to be at their polling station on polling day, as often they register at university only to find that they are back home at the other side of the country come polling day. 

Online voting would solve this issue and could also remind people to vote on polling day.

attributes.action: Change the law. Make Civil & Family Judges accountable in law and to Parliament.
attributes.background: Most people do not know that currently Judges cannot be prosecuted for Judicial Acts. Most Judges are excellent, but some are not. This new law shall give us the people the right to challenge them. Only right in our modern society. Judges shall remain unelected yes, but accountable they must become.
attributes.additional_details:
This reform law shall make Judges accountable for Misconduct in Public Office if for example they fail to:

1 Disclose Conflicts of Interest with any person involved in a case they hear. 

2 Fail to inform the Police if they discover  evidence of crime in a Family or Civil case.

Secondly if a Civil Judge fails to adhere to, or enforce a Statute of Parliament, thus the will of Parliament, which is after all the will of the people, they can be brought to Parliament to face Contempt of Parliament

attributes.action: Make sports playing fields dog free areas - we need to protect our children.
attributes.background: I am a grassroots football coach and am becoming increasingly angered by the amount of time spent picking up dog faeces before training and matches. Talking to coaches from around the country this is a national problem. TIME TO BAN DOGS FROM ALL PLAYING FIELDS for the sake of our children.
attributes.additional_details:
My club in the East End of Newcastle have pushed hard to protect the kids, however the irresponsible dog owners appear at times that the wardens aren't around.
We have been highlighted in the Newcastle Evening Chronicle and some people have been fined but the practice of being ignorant by some people just doesn't stop.

attributes.action: Bring back the DEATH penalty for PAEDOPHILES.
attributes.background: Shield Appeal is a campaign to protect the babies and children of our country . We all want the death penalty for PAEDOPHILES.
attributes.additional_details: We can't continue to allow the babies of our country to be raped and abused by these beasts . They all need to die . No more prison, no more costing the tax payers millions of pounds . Hang them .

attributes.action: Repeal legislation obliging Government to give-away 0.7% of GDP in overseas aid.
attributes.background: Current legislation obliging UK governments to give away 0.7% of GDP in overseas aid should be repealed; enabling future governments to determine levels of overseas aid commensurate with the then prevailing economic position of the UK and competing demands in welfare support of British citizens.

attributes.action: To grant Reading (Berkshire) city status as a key hub in Thames Valley
attributes.background: Reading (Berkshire) has a population of 232,000 and is a key hub for the Thames Valley region.  Its importance should be recognised and given city status.  We the people of Reading are now asking the Lord Chancellor to recommend to the Monarch, the granting of city status to Reading.
attributes.additional_details:
Reading is a Vibrant City that contributes significantly to our economy and culture.  It is one of the largest towns worthy of City status.

The town applied in 2012 and was disappointed after a long application process.  It was not selected as one of the three cities chosen but we strongly believe that it should be chosen.

attributes.action: Prevent leaders of countries that ban entry of Israelis/Jews from coming to UK
attributes.background: Leaders of countries that ban the entry of Israelis or Jews should be allowed to enter the UK in their capacity as head of their Government, but should not be invited to make an official State Visit because it would cause embarrassment to Her Majesty the Queen.
attributes.additional_details:
You will be shocked that in the 21st century there are countries which ban entry to their borders based on religion!

Countries (including airlines) which ban Israelis/Jews from entering their borders include:  Algeria,Bangladesh,Brunei,Iran,Iraq,Kuwait, Lebanon,Libya,Malaysia,Oman,Pakistan,Saudi Arabia,Sudan,Syria, United Arab Emirates,Yemen

They are however free to enter Israel! 

The government should also pressurize these countries to reverse this disgraceful policies.

attributes.action: Allow England to have its own Parliament devolved from Westminster.
attributes.background: Where Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland are allowed their own devolved parliaments so they can vote on laws specific to them without English interference, we desire our own parliament to vote on English specific laws, and to be granted the same rights and power.

attributes.action: To keep the Four Freedoms as defined by membership of the EEA even after Brexit.
attributes.background: All those who voted Remain and many who voted Leave are in favour of the Four Freedoms and accept that this includes Free Movement of People. These voters are the true majority. Restricting European migration was NOT an option on the ballot paper and should not, therefore, be a Brexit "deal breaker"
attributes.additional_details: For example, many small businesses voted Leave in protest of excessive EU regulations. Many more individuals voted Leave because they believed it would help fund the NHS. Plenty voted Leave to give the UK sovereignty over its own Laws. Others voted in protest of the Tory policy of austerity. Only a MINORITY of the voters voted Leave to control migration. The Government should, therefore, keep the Four Freedoms in the Brexit negotiations as is the wish of the voting majority.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to make all strike action on the railways illegal.
attributes.background: The ongoing strike action by Southern Rail staff has caused misery for hundreds of thousands of commuters, in some cases leading to people losing their jobs. In 21st Century Britain this should not be allowed.  The rest of us have to go to work every day - why should they hold the UK to ransom?
attributes.additional_details: I take Southern trains back from work every day.  They have been either late or cancelled about 95% of the time over the last year.

attributes.action: Give teachers the choice to retire at 55 with full retirement benefits.
attributes.background: Teachers can retire at the age of 55 but with reduced retirement benefits. The government should give teachers the choice to retire at the age of 55 with full retirement benefits (worked out by the number of years an individual has paid into their pension).
attributes.additional_details:
More teachers would choose to retire early and therefore could be replaced with newly qualified teachers. The benefits would be:
* Mature teachers who wish to retire early could do so without worrying about financial barriers.
* The teaching profession will be more appealing.
* If the teachers were to be replaced by newly qualified teachers, it would cost less.
* Happier schools with enthusiastic teachers who actually want to be there instead of having teachers who have no choice but to be there just because they can't afford to retire on the small fraction currently offered

attributes.action: Stop the closing of emergency mental health services (Weller Wing) in Bedford.
attributes.background: Weller Wing (Mental health ward) has been deemed "not fit for purpose". The 17 in-patients have been transferred to Houghten Regis, and the ward will be completely closed to out-patients too by March, with no time frame or budget for the services return.
attributes.additional_details: Weller Wing is not fit for purpose, so fix it, don't get rid of the only emergency mental health service we have. 1 in 4 people suffer with mental health problems, that's around 19,700 people in Bedford who would benefit from this service. All we have now is a promise that it will return, but there's currently no time frame or budget for that. It is negligent to just bin the service with no future plans, as opposed to fixing the service.

attributes.action: Increase minimum wage for 18+ year olds to the same as the national living wage
attributes.background:
At the age of 18 you have to pay ADULT prices, if we are having to pay adult prices we should be paid the same! Additionally if we are doing the SAME job as someone 25 we should get the SAME pay! 

Some 18-24 year olds have families etc with bills and rent to pay the same as 25+ year olds!

attributes.action: Discuss the competency of Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.
attributes.background: The Alexandra Hospital in Redditch is slowly being downgraded by the Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.  Why?
attributes.additional_details:
The people of Redditch, Studley and Bromsgrove are affected because:
The public transport links from Redditch to Worcester are poor.
Maternity and Paedeatrics have already closed at Redditch.
The consultants are leaving the Alexandra Hospital, so more wards are closing.
The parking at Worcester Royal Hospital is inadequate.
Worcester Royal Hospital cannot cope with more patients.

The government should launch an investigation into the Trusts finances and its actions to remove services from Redditch Alexandra in favour of Worcester Royal.

attributes.action: Help create an international fund to counteract the U.S. 'global gag rule'.
attributes.background: The new U.S. President has reinstated legislation which threatens U.S.-funded aid organisations with withdrawal of funding should they offer women abortions or advocate abortion rights. The right to bodily autonomy is a fundamental human right and we must not allow it to be threatened.
attributes.additional_details: Marie Stopes International estimates that the loss of their services alone could lead to 6.5m unintended pregnancies, 2.1m unsafe abortions, and 21,700 maternal deaths. We call upon HM Government to increase its foreign health aid commitments and help mitigate the devastating impact of this legislation. The Dutch government has already launched plans for an international fund and we ask that the U.K. to contribute to this effort, and so help defend the rights of millions of vulnerable women.

attributes.action: Make our motorways safe. Keep the hard shoulders
attributes.background:
On 14th February 2015 my brother along with 3 other passengers were killed after a night out when their car had broken down on the hard shoulder.
Although the signs clearly stated the lane was for emergency use only, a driver continued to drive in the hard shoulder.
attributes.additional_details:
If the hard shoulder was for emergency use at all times this would never have happened.
This is not the first time people have been killed and it certainly wont be the last.
If we brake down on the motorway, where is our safe place?
We are all in unnecessary danger if we allow our motorways to have 'Smart lanes.'
70% of drivers feel unsafe driving on the motorway and there are concerns how long the gaps are to find a safe place to stop and many ignore the signs.

attributes.action: Election Manifestos of political parties must become legally binding contracts
attributes.background: The Parties publicly declare their policies that they promise to deliver if elected into office this is the Election Manifesto. There is no legal mechanism in place besides general/local elections to hold parties to account. Election Manifestos should be made into legally binding contracts.
attributes.additional_details:
If a elected government, local council, elected mayor or assembly breaks the contract they've delivered to the electorate. The party in question should be taken to the British Courts if found guilty the punishment should be a fine the payment would be from the parties own funding and not from the tax payer to deter uk parties from purposefully deceiving the electorate.
 
https://www.theguardian.com/notesandqueries/query/0,,-203998,00.html

http://www.thefreedictionary.com/Electoral+manifesto

attributes.action: Amend Housing Act 1988 to stop care home owners banning restricting and evicting
attributes.background: Your Voice Matters was set up after I was unfairly banned from a care home http://www.yourvoicematters.org.uk/rights2speakup4care  Providers possess the powers of a landlord. They can ban, restrict loved ones (or any professional) and evict residents; PRIVATE paying residents have no protection.
attributes.additional_details: The Care Act 2014 alleges residents fully or partially funded and placed by L.A.'s are protected under the Human Rights Act 1998, unlike self-funders. CQC guidelines (2/11/16) purport that residents are protected under Article 8 BUT the Housing Act 1988 provides ultimate powers for providers to ban, restrict and evict; some instigate malicious falsehood and staff will support as fearful of reprisals. For this reason The Housing Act 1988 needs amending. www.yourvoicematters.org.uk
attributes.creator_name: Jenny Moore - Your Voice Matters CIC

attributes.action: Update Housing Association tenants on the right to buy. We voted in good faith!
attributes.background: Give HA tenants some information and a timeline regarding right to buy extension. There have been no updates on the pilot scheme and there has now been talk of the right to buy extension not being completed till 2020 this is a totally unacceptable timeline.

attributes.action: Give grandparents the right to see their grandchildren.
attributes.background: I have not seen my grandchildren in over 3 years. Currently there is no law in place which allows grandparents to see their grandchildren. There should be a law in which we should see them regardless  of relations between the sets of parents.  there are 'no winners' with the current law.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter got a new partner and for some unknown reason he did not like us seeing our grandchildren. They have recently moved away and we now have absolutely no way of contacting or seeing our grandchildren.

attributes.action: Childcare Element of Tax Credits, paid directly to Childcare providers.
attributes.background: As a group of Childminders we have all, at some point, experienced not being paid by parents/carers of the children we look after for childcare we have provided. Most of the parents/carers we work with receive the childcare element of Tax Credits, yet still fail to make payment.

attributes.action: Offer free 20 hours of childcare to all families, with children age 1 year plus.
attributes.background: There is a significant gap in the provision of childcare. Parents/carers are encouraged to return to work after averagely taking a year off after having a baby. But when working, they have little disposable income because it mainly goes on childcare.
attributes.additional_details: The Joseph's roundtree foundation has recently published findings which included: that 60% of in-work families are currently in poverty. Many social issues would be resolved if there were less financial and emotional strain on families. This type of policy would efficiently use all the talent lost when people start a family. It makes sense in these uncertain and difficult economic times. Let's make a difference to our future generations lives!

attributes.action: Make a law about the ratio of staff to residents in a care home with dementia.
attributes.background: I have seen how things are run in my mother's care home and we are neglecting these vulnerable people. There are not enough staff for the care and well being of the residents. I am one of very few relatives who visit regularly. After all most of us will end up in this situation.
attributes.additional_details:
Of course the answer is that more staff are needed
At the moment there is no law regulating the ratio of staff per resident, only guidelines set out by CQC, which in essence let the care home decide the best way to manage their staff. So it’s a money issue - care homes charge between £700 to £1000 per week. My mother is self funded so we are eating our way through her savings very quickly, she has a terminal illness just like many others but her treatment is not fre

attributes.action: Introduce Safety Standards for Pet Food, Treats and Toys
attributes.background: Cooked bones and rawhide chews aimed at dogs are a serious choking risk and can cause intestinal problems and even death yet these are still sold in many pet shops and major retailers so people think they are safe. Please ban cooked bones, rawhide chews and any pet treats and toys containing toxins.
attributes.additional_details:
http://healthypets.mercola.com/sites/healthypets/archive/2010/05/19/caution-bones-can-kill-your-dog-find-out-which-ones-are-safe.aspx

http://pets.webmd.com/rawhide-good-or-bad-for-your-dog

attributes.action: Make 'puppy farm' licensing stringently regulated in the U.K. to avoid suffering
attributes.background: Some of the licensed farms hold >100 breeding bitches caged in less than 1 cubic meter, no daylight, nowhere to toilet having litter after litter, true breeding machines! Puppies are taken away too early adding more cruelty to these dogs' life making life unbearable for these intelligent animals
attributes.additional_details:
Regulate conditions for breeding dogs on licensed puppy farms. Breeding dogs have less protected rights than battery farm chickens and are scrupulously used as money makers by licensed farms. Some 'breeders' don't even bother to kill the bitches once they have had too many litters, they are just left to starve.
Regulate number of breeding bitches per licensed establishment, all to be kept in approved sized kennels with daylight and daily outdoor runs & regulate the number of litters per bitch

attributes.action: Remove rail franchise from Southeastern (Govia Ltd)
attributes.background: Southeastern provide a consistent poor service to their customers, causing genuine misery and despair to thousands of commuters in the South East. They put profit before customers and effect the daily lives of people who just want to get to work on time and in comfort. No more debating, take action!

attributes.action: Keep our community hospital open
attributes.background: We desperately need this hospital in a town the size of Saltash . The poor transport links to Derriford and Liskeard will be a huge problem to those who need minor injury treatment .

attributes.action: Amend Shortage Occupation rules that are blocking the hiring of Specialist Chefs
attributes.background: UK's Asian cuisine industry is lacking skill ready Professional Chefs. Though Chefs are on government's Shortage Occupation list it disqualifies restaurants that allow collection or delivery of restaurant meals as NOT having specialist skill needs in spite of this involving the same skill input
attributes.additional_details:
The industry is in urgent need of experienced skill ready Chefs from outside EU on temporary basis to support business operations, and to enable training and development of home grown Chefs. However this is being prevented by inappropriate rules. This petition calls for following amendments to the Shortage Occupation rules 

1. Remove the 'take away' clause

2. Raise skill recognition to NQF level 6  

3. Amend minimum salary to £25,000 

4. Allow temporary non settlement based UK entry

attributes.action: Stop MPs banning the RSPCA from prosecuting those who are cruel to animals.
attributes.background: A group of MPs are trying to stop the RSPCA from prosecuting those who starve, beat, stab, burn and abuse poor defensless animals.
attributes.additional_details: The RSPCA is paid for by public donations (animal lovers) and not through taxes therefore has nothing to do with MP's. With over 200 years of experience the RSPCA does a fantastic job at protecting the welfare of animals including prosecuting those who are cruel to them. Don't let MP's take this power away so that animals become a lesser priority. Who else do they have?

attributes.action: Form all party commission into social care provision
attributes.background:
We ALL know social care is in crisis. We need a 'joined-up' approach to social care and health that is 
- realistic about both need and cost
- reduces the party political blame game
- thinks long-term
- recognises the urgency for radical reform

attributes.action: Impose Economic Sanctions on Turkey.
attributes.background: The Turkish state has one of the worst human rights records in modern history, they are also the largest sponsor of terrorism in Syria, using Refugees as a political tool to manipulate foreign police and purging all opponents. This is dangerous. We must impose sanctions to bring Erdogan to heel.

attributes.action: Make Asthma Treatment FREE For Asthma Sufferers
attributes.background: I am a life long Asthma Sufferer. I was born with the conditions and throughout my life, I have always wondered why other conditions such as Diabetes and Epilepsy get free medication?
attributes.additional_details:
I am most worried about the 250,000 with severe (uncontrollable) asthma. It's thought they make up more than half of asthma deaths. Costs of their treatments can be considerable - they often need powerful steroid tablets and antibiotics.

Emergency hospital admissions for adults are estimated to cost the NHS £61 million a year and many relate to poor asthma control. 

Better access to medicines keeps people healthy, out of hospital and working. 

Those who manage the budget always look to save money, but charging asthma patients for prescriptions is a back-to-front and morally questionable way to do it.

attributes.action: Ensure all premises offering Electric Vehicle Chargers enforce EV only parking.
attributes.background: All premises(e.g. Supermarkets)should be mandated to enforce EV only parking in the space next to an Electric Charger if offering this service.This simple move nationwide would masssively boost the uptake & use of EVs. Hence help reduce air pollution in UK cities and decrease CO2 emissions.
attributes.additional_details: EV drivers are regularly frustrated in using Chargers,being frequently blocked by Non-EV Internal Combustion Engine cars (colloquially referred to by EV community as being ICE'd).Although there has been an expansion in number chargers inU.K,to be more than a token gesture it must be coupled with restricting parking bays to EVs. There are multitudes of evidence if search social media for term "ICE'd", see example here.Best regards https://twitter.com/broccoliinmilk/status/818393145503260672

attributes.action: Allow people who need IVF to have babies to have 2 live births through the NHS.
attributes.background: At the moment you can only have one live baby through the NHS with their IVF scheme. This is a petition to allow people who need IVF treatment to have at least two live babies with NHS funding. Both tries should allow two fresh and two frozen cycles.
attributes.additional_details: Currently you are only allowed two fresh and two frozen tries to conceive a baby. If you fall pregnant on these tries you are no longer allowed to have NHS funding for future babies. On average private IVF treatment costs around £8,000 for one attempt. Although it is fantastic to have one child most parents want their children to have a sibling and this should be on the NHS with funding from them too.
